titleStmt.title: James. F. Zimmerman to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG2579

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: I send certificate of election of James P. Mitchell, Esq., to fill vacancy in the office of County Judge. He is of opinion that he must be commissioned, and declines to act until he ascertains whether it is required in such a case, though some of the bar, think from the Statute, that a commission is not required. He desires me to request that his commission, if one is necessary, be forwarded immediately, and if not that he be notified of the fact, as we are now without a Judge. His address is Danville

Yours, truly,
Jas F. Zimmerman. C B C C

To the Secy of State,
Frankfort, Ky.
